title: 5 takeaways from the Revolution’s season-opening defeat in Nashville
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution lost 4-1 to Nashville SC in the 2026 MLS season opener at Geodis Park.
Revolution's defense struggled with three key defenders missing, leading to early goals for Nashville.
Head coach Marko MitroviÄ‡ faces challenges balancing system implementation and securing points amid roster weaknesses.

title: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station break down again
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: New commuter rail fare gates at South Station have been closed twice due to harsh winter conditions.
The gates, costing $1.3 million, have faced issues with snow and wind despite being positioned for weather impacts.
MBTA reports increased mTicket activations by 42% at South Station, indicating progress in combating fare evasion.

title: Watch: Jack Hughes delivers USA first Olympic gold medal in men’s hockey since 1980, team honors Johnny Gaudreau
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jack Hughes scored the overtime game-winning goal as USA defeated Canada 2-1 for Olympic men's hockey gold.
Team USA honored late NHL star Johnny Gaudreau during celebrations with his children joining the team on ice.
Bruins players Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman earned gold; first active Bruins to win since 2014 Olympics.

title: After homering in spring training debut, could Andruw Monasterio play big role for Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Andruw Monasterio hit a home run in the Red Sox' Grapefruit League opener against the Twins.
Monasterio impressed manager Alex Cora, who praised him as a versatile athlete capable of hitting left-handed pitching.
With Romy Gonzalez injured, Monasterio is a strong candidate for the Red Sox' primary platoon infielder role in 2026.

title: MSP arrests Maine man after he allegedly crashed truck twice while on drugs
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Andrew Beaulieu, 30, of Carthage, Maine, was arrested Thursday after allegedly crashing his truck twice while on drugs.
Beaulieu crashed at a Bridgewater rest area and later in Westport; police suspect he was using synthetic cannabinoids.
He faces multiple charges, including operating under the influence, and is scheduled for a court appearance on March 3.

title: Methuen woman searching for her wedding dress after dry cleaner mix-up
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Kathleen Shea Dunleavy from Methuen is searching for her missing wedding dress after a 15-year dry cleaner mix-up.
Dunleavy discovered she had someone else's gown and reunited it with its owner using a Facebook post.
The missing dress, last handled by a closed Methuen cleaner, has distinct embroidery and button features.

title: At Chevalier Theatre, Mavis Staples lives up to her legacy of joy and protest
author: Terence Cawley
bullets: Mavis Staples performed a 12-song set at the Chevalier Theatre, Medford, emphasizing joy and protest themes.
The 86-year-old artist combined gospel-soul roots with Americana, collaborating with artists like Jeff Tweedy.
Staples included songs addressing social issues and paid tribute to civil rights leader John Lewis during her performance.

title: Here’s how the Red Sox plan on handling MLB’s new ABS challenging system
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Red Sox player Wilson Contreras successfully used the new ABS challenge system during spring training against a strike three call.
Beginning in 2026, MLB teams can challenge ball and strike calls, with each team given two challenges per game.
Younger Red Sox players like Roman Anthony and Marcelo Mayer are familiar with ABS from Triple-A experiences.

title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Lucas Giolito, a free agent after leaving the Red Sox, remains unsigned despite a strong 2025 season.
Garrett Crochet expressed surprise over Giolito's free-agent status, highlighting his strong performance and value.
The Red Sox added Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez, making a return for Giolito unlikely for the 2026 season.

title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Michael Pittman Jr. of the Colts faces trade rumors due to a high salary cap, with the Patriots showing interest.
Potential Patriots target DJ Moore from the Bears recorded 682 yards and six touchdowns in a subpar 2025 season.
Uchenna Nwosu of the Seahawks, with a $20.7 million cap hit, is a trade option amidst Seattle's free agency challenges.
